Utterance: Hi! It’s great to see you again. How have things been since our last session?
Hi, Ellie! Things have been pretty good. We’ve been celebrating our daughter’s little wins, and it seems to be working.
That’s fantastic news! How has she reacted to the celebrations?
She’s been really excited about it. It’s motivated her to try harder in school.
That’s wonderful to hear! It sounds like you’re creating a positive reinforcement cycle. Have you noticed any changes in her behavior as a result?
Yes, she seems more engaged and willing to ask for help when she needs it.
That’s a significant improvement! Encouraging her to ask for help is a great step. How do you feel about the progress you’re making as a parent?
I feel proud. It’s nice to see her responding positively to our efforts.
That’s great! It’s important to acknowledge your successes. Have you been able to apply any conflict resolution strategies with your girlfriend?
Yes, we’ve been trying to communicate better. I’ve been more open about my feelings, and it’s helped.
That’s a positive development! How has she responded to your openness?
She’s been receptive and has opened up more as well. It feels like we’re on the same team now.
That’s wonderful to hear! Working together as a team can strengthen your relationship. Have you encountered any challenges while implementing these strategies?
There were a couple of times we slipped back into old habits, but we caught ourselves quickly.
That’s completely normal! Change takes time, and it’s great that you’re recognizing those moments. What do you think helped you catch those habits?
I think being aware of our goals has kept us focused. Plus, we remind each other to stay on track.
That’s an effective strategy! Supporting each other can create a more positive environment. Is there anything specific you’d like to work on today?
I’d like to explore how to handle disagreements better, especially when we’re both stressed.
That’s a valuable topic. Stress can amplify disagreements. What strategies have you tried so far to manage stress during conflicts?
We’ve tried taking breaks to cool down before discussing things, which helps.
Taking breaks can be a great way to regain perspective. Have you found it easy to implement that strategy?
Sometimes it’s hard to remember to take a break when emotions run high.
That’s understandable. Would it help to establish a signal or phrase that indicates when one of you needs a break?
That could work! It would be a gentle reminder without escalating things.
Absolutely! Having a mutual understanding can help both of you feel more secure in those moments. What phrase do you think would work for you?
Maybe something simple like “Let’s take a moment” would be good.
That sounds effective! It’s clear and non-confrontational. How do you feel about using that in the future?
I think it’ll help a lot. It’ll give us both a moment to breathe.
That’s great to hear! Along with that, have you considered any other stress-relief techniques you can use individually?
I’ve been trying to exercise more. It helps clear my mind.
Exercise is a fantastic way to relieve stress. How has that been going for you?
It’s been good! I feel more energized and focused after a workout.
That’s excellent! Incorporating regular exercise can enhance your overall well-being. Is there anything else you’d like to discuss today?
I think I’m good for now. Just focusing on these strategies is a lot to process!
That’s perfectly okay! It’s important to take things one step at a time. For our next session, we can check in on how the strategies are working and explore any new challenges that arise.
Sounds good! I appreciate your help.
You’re doing great! I look forward to hearing about your progress next time.
Thanks, Ellie. Bye!
Bye! Take care!
